English: "[f1きおくのだんぺん]" has been inscribed.
Chinese: 『[f1きおくのだんぺん]』已刻上……
Korean: 『[f1きおくのだんぺん]』이 새겨졌다…
German: „[f1きおくのだんぺん]“ wurde notiert.

English: What was that?
Chinese: 剛才的是……？
Korean: 바, 방금 그건…???
German: Was war das?

English:
An honest-to-goodness ghost?!
Maybe THAT was Mr. Navit?!
That couldn't have been... a Digimon?!
Chinese:
真正的……「幽靈」？
那個才是……「NAVIT」？
難道是……「數碼寶貝」？
Korean:
진짜…「유령」!?
저게…「내빗군」!?
설마…「디지몬」!?
German:
Ein ganz echter Geist?!
Vielleicht war DAS Herr Navit?!
Es kann doch kein ... Digimon gewesen sein?!

English:
Kowloon's as dangerous as they say.
Who knows what might happen here?
Chinese:
Kowloon……跟傳說中的一樣是很危險的區域。
無法預測會發生什麼事……
Korean:
쿠롱… 소문대로 위험한 에어리어야
무슨 일이 일어날지 모르겠어…
German:
Kowloon ist so gefährlich, wie alle sagen.
Wer weiß, was hier passieren kann?

English:
I better hurry up, find Arata, and get out of
here.
Chinese: 得快點找到新，回到安全的區域……
Korean: 빨리 아라타를 찾아서, 안전한 에어리어로…―
German:
Ich sollte mich beeilen, Arata finden
und hier verschwinden.

English: What's wrong? You look like you've seen a ghost.
Chinese: 怎麼了？一臉看到“幽靈”的樣子？
Korean: 왜 그러지? 마치, "유령"이라도 본 듯한 얼굴이군
German:
Was ist? Du siehst aus, als hättest du einen
Geist gesehen.

English: You saw a ghost that looked like me?
Chinese: 你說看到跟我一模一樣的幽靈……？
Korean: ……나랑 꼭 닮은 유령을 봤다고?
German: Du hast einen Geist gesehen, der aussah wie ich?

English:
If that's true, that ghost might have been me.
Some call me the "Wraith of EDEN".
Chinese:
那……那個幽靈說不定就是我。
因為也有人稱我為“棲居在EDEN裡的幽鬼”……
Korean:
그렇다면… 그 유령은, 나일지도 모르겠군
나를 "EDEN에 사는 유령"이라 부르는 자도 있어…
German:
Wenn das stimmt, dann war ich das vielleicht.
Manche nennen mich das „Gespenst von EDEN“.

English: They say I am not of this world.
Chinese: 還說我不是這個世上的人。
Korean: 이 세상 사람이 아니다, 라고
German: Sie sagen, ich gehöre nicht zu dieser Welt.

English:
The truth is simply that I'm rather elusive and
tend to turn up unexpectedly. That's all.
Chinese:
真相就是——
我只是“神出鬼沒”……如此而已。
Korean:
진상은―
나는 그저 "신출귀몰"할 뿐… 그게 다야
German:
In Wahrheit bleibe ich lieber für mich
und erscheine unerwartet. Mehr nicht.

English:
Please, relax. I'm not a ghost.
I am very real here in EDEN.
Chinese:
你放心吧……我不是幽靈。
我實際存在於EDEN裡。
Korean:
안심해… 난 유령이 아니야
이 EDEN에, 제대로 존재하고 있어
German:
Bitte beruhige dich. Ich bin kein Geist.
Hier in EDEN bin ich ganz real.

English: I exist to guide those who are lost, like you.
Chinese: 為了引導像你這種“迷途羔羊”……
Korean: …너 같은 "미아"를 인도하기 위해서 말이야
German:
Ich bin hier, um denen zu helfen, die sich verirrt
haben. Wie dir.

English:
You've just had a program installed, Digimon
Capture, which marks you as a hacker.
Chinese:
你才剛拿到身為駭客的證明，
「數碼寶貝捕捉器」程式。
Korean:
넌, 해커의 증표인 프로그램
「디지몬 캡처」를 막 손에 넣은 참―
German:
Bei dir wurde gerade ein Programm installiert,
Digimon-Fang. Das markiert dich als Hacker.

English: But you are still merely a fledgling hacker.
Chinese: 也就是說，你還只是個「雛鳥駭客」。
Korean: 말하자면,「병아리 해커」야
German: Aber dein Hackerleben fängt gerade erst an.

English:
There are hackers with a wide variety of different
goals here in EDEN.
Chinese: EDEN裡有各式各樣的駭客。
Korean: EDEN에는, 다양한 목적을 가진 해커들이 있어
German:
Hier in EDEN gibt es Hacker mit ganz vielen
unterschiedlichen Zielen.

English:
Chivalrous ones who find and report security
holes. Thieves who steal accounts to rob money and
data. Others are just out to prove their skills.
Chinese:
有找出資安漏洞加以報告的義賊，
也有覬覦他人財產和個資，搶奪帳號的人，
也有磨練自己的技術，單純想試試自己能耐的人——
Korean:
보안 구멍을 발견해서 보고하는 의적 같은 자
타인의 재산이나 개인정보를 노리고, 계정을 강탈하는 자
자신의 기술을 연마하고, 그저 힘을 시험해 보고 싶은 자―
German:
Es gibt edelmütige, die Sicherheitslücken finden
und melden. Andere stehlen Konten, Geld und Daten.
Wieder andere wollen zeigen, was sie können.

English:
Truly, a wide variety.
What kind of hacker do you want to be?
Chinese:
有非常多種類型……
你想當哪種駭客呢？
Korean:
정말 가지각색, 이야…
넌, 어떤 해커가 되고 싶어?
German:
Eine wahrhaft große Vielfalt.
Was möchtest du für ein Hacker sein?

English:
You are indeed a fledgling if that is your only
response. Not even hatched from your egg yet.
Chinese:
看你那個樣子……連雛鳥都不是……
根本還沒從蛋裡孵出來吧。
Korean:
그 상태를 보아하니… 병아리는커녕
아직 알에서 부화하지도 않은 모양이군
German:
Wenn du sonst nichts zu sagen hast, bist
du wirklich noch ein Grünschnabel.

English:
You're free to become a hacker, if you want.
Or something else altogether. It's up to you.
Chinese:
要成為駭客，還是其他職業……
都是你的自由。
Korean:
해커를 목표로 할지, 아니면 다른 무언가가 될지…
그건, 네 자유야
German:
Du kannst ein Hacker werden, wenn du willst.
Oder etwas ganz anderes. Du hast die Wahl.

English: What led you to this is neither here nor there.
Chinese: 但不管前因後果為何——
Korean: 하지만, 경위가 어떻든―
German: Wie du hier gelandet bist, tut nichts zur Sache.

English:
You came here because you were interested in
hacking, and now, because of that, you've got the
"Digimon Capture" program, yes?
Chinese:
你都是因為對駭客感興趣才會來到這裡，
結果獲得了「數碼寶貝捕捉器」……對吧？
Korean:
넌, 해커에 흥미를 갖고 이곳까지 왔고, 그 결과
「디지몬 캡처」를 손에 넣었어… 그렇지?
German:
Du bist hergekommen, weil dich Hacking
interessiert hat, und hast deswegen jetzt
das Programm „Digimon-Fang“, ja?

English:
I would therefore recommend you give the
remarkable power of these "Digimon" programs a
try.
Chinese:
既然這樣，那就試試看吧……
試試看這個被稱為「數碼寶貝」的程式，威力有多驚人。
Korean:
그럼, 시험해 보도록 해…
「디지몬」이라 불리는 프로그램의, 놀라운 힘을
German:
Ich würde dir folglich empfehlen, das
bemerkenswerte Potenzial dieser „Digimon“-
Programme auszutesten.

English:
That's fine.
Now, to commemorate your birth as a fellow hacker-
to-be...
Chinese:
非常好。
那麼，為了慶祝未來的駭客誕生——
Korean:
…좋아
그럼, 미래의 "동료(해커)" 탄생을 축하하며―
German:
Ist schon in Ordnung.
Nun, zur Feier deines Einstands als
zukünftiger Hacker ...

English: I shall present you with your first Digimon.
Chinese: 我就送你值得紀念的第一隻數碼寶貝吧。
Korean: 너에게, 기념할 첫 번째 디지몬을 주겠어
German: Überreiche ich dir dein erstes Digimon.

English: There, behind you. That is a Digimon program.
Chinese: 看，就在你身後……那就是數碼寶貝程式。
Korean: 봐봐, 네 뒤에 있어… 저게 디지몬 프로그램이다
German: Da, hinter dir. Das ist ein Digimon-Programm.
